errorResponses.reason: is returned if the edge was created successfully.
is returned if the edge collection was not found.

parameters.name: collection
parameters.description: Creates a new edge in the collection identified by collection name.

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: The document handle of the start point must be passed in from handle.

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: The document handle of the end point must be passed in to handle.

parameters.name: edge-document
parameters.description: A JSON representation of the edge document must be passed as the body of the POST request. This JSON object may contain the edge's document key in the _key attribute if needed.

operations.notes:
from handle and to handle are immutable once the edge has been created.

In all other respects the method works like POST /document, see the manual for details.
operations.examples:
Create an edge and reads it back: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/edge/?collection=edges&from=vertices/1&to=vertices/2
{"name":"Emil"}

HTTP/1.1 202 Accepted
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: "328452028"
location: /_api/document/edges/328452028

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "_id" : "edges/328452028", 
  "_rev" : "328452028", 
  "_key" : "328452028" 
}

unix> curl --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/edge/edges/328452028

HTTP/1.1 200 OK
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8
etag: "328452028"

{ 
  "name" : "Emil", 
  "_id" : "edges/328452028", 
  "_rev" : "328452028", 
  "_key" : "328452028", 
  "_from" : "vertices/1", 
  "_to" : "vertices/2" 
}
